results.title: Matter waves
results.creator_credit: John Friedman, Bell Telephone Laboratories and Educational Services
results.brief_description: A modern version of the original experiment showing the wave behaviour of the electron diffraction patterns on a fluorescent screen, making the patterns understandable in terms of wave behaviour by presenting an optical analogue showing almost identical patterns. Describes the electron diffraction experiments of Sir George Thompson and presents brief evidence for the wave behaviour of other particles, such as neutrons and helium atoms.

results.title: Matter of heart
results.brief_description: This is an inspiring portrait of Carl Gustav Jung, a man whose genius and humanity caused his voice to reach far beyond the exclusive realm of psychiatry into redefining the essential nature of who we are and what we hope to become. More than just a linear biography, this program presents a fuller perspective of this healer, using rare home movies, archival footage, and a wealth of interviews.

results.title: Matt Mann and his swimming techniques
results.brief_description: The various techniques developed in USA by matt Mann for teaching groups pf boys to swim are demonstrated. The crawl, the backstroke, breast stoke, and butterfly, are separately illustrated, from the beginning land drills to the completed stroke in the water.

results.title: Matisse & the Fauves
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau Inc
results.brief_description: Documents the search of Henri Matisse and other painters for a greater intensity of colour based upon their belief that the impact of a painting comes from its coloured surface. Shows Matisse’s developing use of bold, simplified brushwork and brilliant unnatural colour.

results.title: Matina Horner: portrait of a person
results.brief_description: Matina Horner is the sixth president of Radliffe College, Massachusetts, whose main concern is with the future of women in the university. Mrs. Horner comments on the administration of institutions such as Radcliffe and Harvard, about young women and young people in general, and the role of educational institutions. Focusing on her Greek heritage shows her early years through photographs and home movies. Includes some animation.

results.title: Matilda country
results.brief_description: Winton is an isolated town in central Queensland, whose history is associated with the writing of the song “Waltzing Matilda” by Banjo Patterson in 1895. Several people of the district including the postmaster, a woman on a station, a station owner and a truck driver, talk about life at Winton. The work of the mail contractor and post office are shown. Devised by Rob Gerrand for Australia Post.

results.title: Maths with everything (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Krish, John Arnold and A Graphic Film
results.brief_description: Demonstrates British child centred methods of teaching mathematics to children aged five to seven. The film’s point is that maths includes all activities if teachers know where to look for opportunities to teach it, using experiences that interest and totally involve the children. Writer John Krish for the Nuffield Mathematics Teaching Project. Explores thematic approach to mathematics. Begins with an in-service program for infant teachers. They construct a mural and then proceed to discover maths in it. A class teacher in a school situation then adopts the same approach using the theme ‘buses’.

results.title: Maths at home
results.brief_description: Illustrates a number of ways in which parents can maximise mathematically orientated activities with their children using everyday home activities. Includes sorting and counting in many forms, Monopoly, map reading and cooking.

results.title: Mathica's mathshop
results.brief_description: Young children learn to recognise, solve and enjoy mathematical problems by putting mathematics in a meaningful context. Viewers are engaged in story-related problems involving numbers, measurement and geometry. Ten episodes of 15 minutes duration dealing with a number of concepts. Based on familiar or traditonal tales, children are given challenges to solve, such as how many different ways can the seven dwarfs go to a picnic if they have two cars. Suitable for Lower Primary students.

results.title: Mathew Brady: photographer of an era
results.brief_description: Presents the history of the American Civil War through the lens of photographer Mathew Brady. This photographic record includes a portion of Lincoln’s second inaugural address. Music by Paul Keuter, featuring folk singer Eleanor Stone.
